image.altText: Tasmania Police officers at crime scene.

props.synopsis: A man who was shot twice in the chest by Tasmania Police after allegedly threatening people with a knife has died in hospital.

title.children: Man shot twice in chest by police dies, officer wounded during confrontation

image.altText: Mountain and houses

props.synopsis: Homes Tasmania was established in 2022 to deliver housing, and homelessness and crisis accommodation. Just two years later, an interstate auditor will conduct a review to determine if the new entity is meeting its targets.

title.children: Tasmania's housing body under review two years into plan to deliver 10,000 affordable homes

image.altText: A colonial-looking lounge room with leather couches, a fire place and red carpet

props.synopsis: The 163-year-old Tasmanian Club has, after much fuss, voted to overturn a rule excluding women from the bar — but before you ladies begin queuing up for a peek inside, please note — you'll still need to be accompanied by a gentleman.

title.children: Women now permitted in the bar at the Tasmanian Club — but they have to be with a man

image.altText: A large red and white passenger ferry in a body of water against a wintery backdrop

props.synopsis: The Spirit of Tasmania IV ferry is making its way across the North Sea to its temporary home in Scotland, but taxpayers are yet to learn how much it will cost to remain there.

title.children: As the newest Spirit of Tasmania ferry heads to its temporary home in Scotland, berthing costs remain unknown

image.altText: A woman with long black hair and a green hoodie embraces her laughing daughter.

props.synopsis: Young mothers in Tasmania report stigma as being the hardest battle they've faced, saying the way they have been treated simply for being young and pregnant is "not OK".

title.children: 'The way that I was treated': Teen mums talk about the biggest issue they faced — society

image.altText: A sign with LGH and emergency written on it.

props.synopsis: Survivors of alleged historical child sexual abuse at a Tasmanian hospital have received a combined $7.85 million settlement, with one claimant saying that while no money could remedy the abuse, it was "life-changing".

title.children: Survivors of paedophiles working at Tasmanian hospital receive $7.85 million compensation

image.altText: The exterior of an old wooden hut surrounded by bush.

props.synopsis: Halls Hut is about as isolated as you can get in Australia's wilderness. A heli-tourism proponent will seek federal approval to fix it up, but is facing extensive opposition from bushwalkers, fly-fishers and environmental groups over the use of a helicopter.

title.children: It's a hut, on an island, in a lake, in the wilderness. Its upkeep has now become a political issue

image.altText: A woman sitting against a kitchen counter at home.

props.synopsis: Mum of two Jane Dutton has made the call to shut down her kids' social media before the ban comes into effect from the end of next year. Like many parents, she felt pressure to allow her children onto the platforms in the first place.

title.children: Did you miss? 📣 Mum who let kids onto social media so they would 'fit in' starts under-16s ban straight away

image.altText: A young woman takes a selfie from her hospital bed

props.synopsis: Despite a cost-of-living crisis, young people aged 25 to 29 have had the biggest take-up of private health insurance over the last year.

title.children: Young people taking up private health insurance in high numbers, reversing 'death spiral' trend

image.altText: The glass facade of a court building bearing a coat of arms.

props.synopsis: The court heard the Sunshine Coast woman was unaware she was committing an offence by failing to report the alleged abuse.

title.children: Mother sentenced for failing to report alleged sexual abuse of eight-year-old daughter

image.altText: Michelle Heyman high-fives Hayley Raso while playing for the Matildas.

props.synopsis: Interim Matildas coach Tom Sermanni says the team is not particularly well-set-up for the future after having such a settled line-up for the past decade.

title.children: Matildas coach says the team hasn't 'planned for the future well enough'

image.altText: A person's hand holding a mobile phone, showing the Spotify logo.

props.synopsis: Australian music lovers are patiently waiting to see what their year in listening looked like as Spotify teases the release of its 2024 wrap.

title.children: When is Spotify Wrapped 2024 coming out and how can I see it?

image.altText: Neale Fraser at Wimbledon in 1962

props.synopsis: Australian tennis great Neale Fraser, a winner of 19 major titles, also won the Davis Cup on eight occasions as player or coach between 1959 and 1993.

title.children: 'He was almost like my second dad': Australian 19-time major winner Neale Fraser dies aged 91 after five decades in tennis spotlight

image.altText: A blonde woman in a blue suit

props.synopsis: Ashley Alsione Ruscoe entered the pleas in Downing Centre Local Court this week, admitting to one count of domestic violence-related assault and one count of stalking or intimidation with intent to cause fear.

title.children: Boxer Harry Garside's ex-girlfriend pleads guilty to assaulting him, apprehended domestic violence order in effect

image.altText: IMAGE Elton John performs on stage

props.synopsis: The Devil Wears Prada Musical has premiered in London's West End but its composer, Sir Elton John, was unable to watch the performance after losing his vision.

title.children: Elton John reveals he is unable to watch his own musical after losing vision

image.altText: man in van with mobile phone sitting on lap

props.synopsis: Mobile detection cameras have so far caught thousands of drivers using their phones illegally in Adelaide. But some have discovered you might still be doing the wrong thing, even if you are not touching your phone with your hands.

title.children: 'I was quite shocked': Drivers in Adelaide receive fines, demerit points for resting phones on laps

image.altText: A man intertwining his fingers while standing at a podium

props.synopsis: French Prime Minister Michel Barnier is bracing for a no-confidence vote this week, a political reckoning almost certain to topple his fragile government and send shock waves across the eurozone.

title.children: French government faces collapse as left and far-right submit no-confidence motions

image.altText: A woman in a blue shirt wears a face mask and is being led by police officers in green uniforms through a courtroom

props.synopsis: A court upholds the death penalty sentence against real estate tycoon Truong My Lan as she scrambles to repay billions of dollars.

title.children: 'It makes me shake all over': Alleged fraud victims react after Vietnam's former richest woman loses appeal against death penalty

image.altText: A sign that reads "Brisbane Water Secondary College Woy Woy Campus" affixed to a stone wall.

props.synopsis: Three high school students on the New South Wales Central Coast have been taken to hospitals in Gosford and Sydney after suffering burns during a failed experiment.

title.children: Three teens injured after high school science experiment goes wrong

image.altText: Head shot of a man with slicked-back blonde hair.

props.synopsis: Kristian White, who was found guilty last week of the manslaughter of Clare Nowland, 95, has been removed from the NSW Police Force by Commissioner Karen Webb.

title.children: Kristian White, who tasered 95yo Clare Nowland, sacked from NSW Police Force

image.altText: Footprints and tools can be seen on a floor covered in white dust.

props.synopsis: Former stonemason Joshua Bucklow has silicosis. His lawyer says his fight for compensation is being dragged out because Israel-based Caesarstone is hiding behind the war in Gaza.

title.children: Caesarstone alleged to be hiding behind war in Gaza to delay potential silicosis compensation payout in Australia

image.altText: Close-up of the cocaine bricks.

props.synopsis: From an unassuming boat moored in the Hervey Bay boat harbour, police were unloading 2.34 tonnes of cocaine — Australia's largest cocaine seizure. But why Hervey Bay?

title.children: A Queensland coastal town becomes the scene of Australia's largest-ever cocaine bust

image.altText: Pokies

props.synopsis: The final report from the Independent Panel on Gaming Reform concluded that the cashless gaming trial was met with a "reluctance from patrons to engage with the technology".

title.children: $3.4m cashless gaming trial that had 14 participants slammed as 'embarrassing and not credible'

image.altText: An aerial shot of a capsized boat in the ocean.

props.synopsis: A man is dead and another is in hospital with hypothermia after the boat they were on capsized off Perth's northern coast.

title.children: Man dies, another in hospital after boat capsizes off Perth coast

image.altText: Achieving their dream of home ownership through hard work and dedication

props.synopsis: Meatworkers Jordan Cullinane, 23, and Remi Krahenbring, 25, knew they didn't want to be paying off someone else's mortgage, so they put their heads down and started saving.

title.children: 'We saved for this': Young couple crack housing dream

image.altText: A young blonde woman smiling in a selfie-style picture.

props.synopsis: In sentencing, the magistrate noted the "extreme extra-curial punishment" Carly McBride has endured since the deadly incident south of Wollongong last year.

title.children: 'Grief-stricken' mum whose sister was fatally stabbed in street brawl avoids jail time for baseball bat attack

image.altText: An elderly couple standing in a field with smoke from a power station in the background

props.synopsis: Jim Radford lived up the road from Fukushima's nuclear power plant before it failed. He has strong feelings about plans for another one near his Gippsland home.

title.children: Latrobe Valley residents weigh up a potential nuclear future to their coal-powered past

image.altText: A large satellite dish points towards the sky.

props.synopsis: Carnarvon's enormous satellite dish is a step closer to being back in action amid a global space and technology boom.

title.children: NASA dish in remote WA receives first signal in almost four decades

image.altText: A torso of a waiter holding a notepad.

props.synopsis: Most research and policy discussions on workplace sexual harassment focus on cisgender heterosexual women, but a landmark study has found most young LGBTQ people, particularly those with a disability, are being sexually harassed in the workplace.

title.children: Almost 80 per cent of young LGBTQ Australians experience sexual harassment at work

image.altText: A man holds two drumsticks in a recording studio with a sign ABC Alice Springs.

props.synopsis: Underneath Jarred Bird's smile, he's pedalling hard to navigate working life with severe dyslexia.

title.children: It took Jarred 18 years to find out he had severe dyslexia. The diagnosis was the 'last piece of the puzzle'

image.altText: Men in army uniform and slouch hats march in formation.

props.synopsis: With the arrival of hundreds of extra personnel to Australia's largest garrison city set to put pressure on an already tight rental market, the federal government has announced plans to build new homes for troops and their families.

title.children: 400 new homes to be built as Townsville braces for influx of troops

image.altText: An elderly man with a grumpy expression pictured with a microphone in front of him

props.synopsis: The United Nations chief expresses concern over a recent escalation in Syria's civil war, which had remained dormant until a recent surprise rebel offensive in Aleppo.

title.children: UN chief 'alarmed' by resurgence of fighting in Syrian civil war as hundreds killed since Aleppo offensive

image.altText: Image of Venus's clouds taken by the Akatsuki spacecraft.

props.synopsis: Venus was once covered in water. Or was it? An analysis of our twin planet’s atmosphere suggests it could never have supported life.

title.children: Scientists thought Venus was once like Earth. A new study suggests it never had water

image.altText: Signs in front of a marquee at an anti-fire ant baiting event.

props.synopsis: Australia's fire ant authority says "downright dangerous" misinformation spread on traditional and social media is hampering its efforts to eradicate the pest.

title.children: Australia is fighting a fire ant invasion, but authorities say they are also locked in a misinformation war

image.altText: A man in a light blue singlet sitting in front of plants.

props.synopsis: Perry Kouroumblis, who is wanted over Melbourne's 1977 Easey Street murders, is expected to arrive back in the city on Tuesday evening, after being extradited from Italy.

title.children: Suspect in Victoria's 1977 Easey Street murders extradited from Italy
